title: Linking modifier `whole-archive` and link time `cfg` are not supported on bundled static libraries

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This is more or less a part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/81490.

If you try to combine `+whole-archive` with (possibly implicit) `+bundle` you will encounter this error: ["linking modifiers `+bundle` and `+whole-archive` are not compatible with each other when generating rlibs"](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/link.rs#L324-L332).
The `whole-archive` modifier is significantly limited due to this issue and cannot be used in `foo-sys` rlibs bundling their native `libfoo.a` dependencies, which is one of the main use cases.

We also have to enable the `+whole-archive` modifier implicitly in one ad hoc case (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/link.rs#L2209-L2213) for backward compatibility, because it cannot be enabled manually.

`cfg` for bundled static libraries was implemented just enough to make the case of musl libc bundled into [libc crate](https://github.com/rust-lang/libc) to work, but it doesn't work in general case.
(Note that musl libc no longer uses bundling, see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72274.)

Also see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88085 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88161 for some discussion related to this issue.
